data.quote: The Bible must be considered as the great source of all the truth by which men are to be guided in government as well as in all social transactions.
data.author: Noah Webster

data.quote: Truth is not only violated by falsehood it may be equally outraged by silence.
data.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

data.quote: Any fool can tell the truth, but it requires a man of some sense to know how to lie well.

data.quote: There is something wonderful in seeing a wrong-headed majority assailed by truth.
data.author: John Kenneth Galbraith

data.quote: What ever truth drops on it eventually grinds to a powder.
data.author: Art Blakey

data.quote: Justice is truth in action.

data.quote: If any man seeks for greatness, let him forget greatness and ask for truth, and he will find both.
data.author: Horace Mann

data.quote: Doubt is the incentive to truth and inquiry leads the way.
data.author: Hosea Ballou

data.quote: Truth is strong, and sometime or other will prevail.

data.quote: Sure I think it is healthy to speak the truth, and be who you are, and be proud of that.
data.author: Nathan Lane

data.quote: Learn what is true in order to do what is right.

data.quote: I always felt that a scientist owes the world only one thing, and that is the truth as he sees it.

data.quote: One may sometimes tell a lie, but the grimace that accompanies it tells the truth.

data.quote: Who never doubted, never half believed. Where doubt is, there truth is - it is her shadow.
data.author: Ambrose Bierce

data.quote: Heresies are experiments in man's unsatisfied search for truth.

data.quote: Truth emerges more readily from error than from confusion.

data.quote: It is more from carelessness about truth than from intentionally lying that there is so much falsehood in the world.

data.quote: Popular opinions, on subjects not palpable to sense, are often true, but seldom or never the whole truth.

data.quote: If you ever injected truth into politics you have no politics.

data.quote: The public will believe anything, so long as it is not founded on truth.

data.quote: Nothing leads the scientist so astray as a premature truth.

data.quote: Man's mind is so formed that it is far more susceptible to falsehood than to truth.

data.quote: Defending the truth is not something one does out of a sense of duty or to allay guilt complexes, but is a reward in itself.

data.quote: There is no original truth, only original error.

data.quote: Wisdom is found only in truth.

data.quote: A petty reason perhaps why novelists more and more try to keep a distance from journalists is that novelists are trying to write the truth and journalists are trying to write fiction.
data.author: Graham Greene

data.quote: I never gave anybody hell! I just told the truth and they thought it was hell.
data.author: Harry S Truman

data.quote: Lawyers enjoy a little mystery, you know. Why, if everybody came forward and told the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth straight out, we should all retire to the workhouse.
data.author: Dorothy L. Sayers

data.quote: As Commander in Chief of the United States Military, I will never send our sons and daughters and our brothers and sisters to die in a foreign land without telling the truth about why they're going there.
data.author: Howard Dean

data.quote: We should not be so taken up in the search for truth, as to neglect the needful duties of active life; for it is only action that gives a true value and commendation to virtue.

data.quote: The object of oratory alone in not truth, but persuasion.
data.author: Thomas Babington Macaulay

data.quote: Not when truth is dirty, but when it is shallow, does the enlightened man dislike to wade into its waters.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: Traditional scientific method has always been at the very best, 20 - 20 hindsight. It's good for seeing where you've been. It's good for testing the truth of what you think you know, but it can't tell you where you ought to go.
data.author: Robert M. Pirsig

data.quote: Truth, which is important to a scholar, has got to be concrete. And there is nothing more concrete than dealing with babies, burps and bottles, frogs and mud.
data.author: Jeane Kirkpatrick

data.quote: The audience is the best judge of anything. They cannot be lied to. Truth brings them closer. A moment that lags - they're gonna cough.
data.author: Barbra Streisand

data.quote: We occasionally stumble over the truth but most of us pick ourselves up and hurry off as if nothing had happened.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: He who sees the truth, let him proclaim it, without asking who is for it or who is against it.
data.author: Henry George

data.quote: For truth is always strange stranger than fiction.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: The American people need to know the truth. The American people need to see the truth. In a democracy, letting the people know the truth is the essence of what it means to be free.
data.author: Barbara Boxer

data.quote: Every scientific truth goes through three states: first, people say it conflicts with the Bible; next, they say it has been discovered before; lastly, they say they always believed it.
data.author: Louis Agassiz

data.quote: Grow your tree of falsehood from a small grain of truth. Do not follow those who lie in contempt of reality. Let your lie be even more logical than the truth itself, so the weary travelers may find repose.

data.quote: In truth, the only restrictions on our capacity to astonish ourselves and each other are imposed by our own minds.
data.author: David Blaine

data.quote: We must never throw away a bushel of truth because it happens to contain a few grains of chaff.
data.author: Dean Stanley

data.quote: I would rather the man who presents something for my consideration subject me to a zephyr of truth and a gentle breeze of responsibility rather than blow me down with a curtain of hot wind.

data.author: Seamus Heaney

data.quote: In fact, in lyric poetry, truthfulness becomes recognizable as a ring of truth within the medium itself.
data.author: Seamus Heaney

data.quote: The modern composer builds upon the foundation of truth.
data.author: Claudio Monteverdi

data.quote: To begin with myself, then, the utterances of men concerning me will differ widely, since in passing judgment almost every one is influenced not so much by truth as by preference, and good and evil report alike know no bounds.
data.author: Petrarch

data.quote: There is in the end no remedy but truth. It is the one course that cannot be evil.
data.author: Ellis Peters

data.quote: It took a deadly illness to put me eye to eye with that truth, but it is a truth that the country, caught up in its ruthless ambitions and moral decay, can learn on my dime.

data.author: Joseph Force Crater

data.quote: Until we have a better relationship between private performance and the public truth, as was demonstrated with Watergate, we as the public are absolutely right to remain suspicious, contemptuous even, of the secrecy and the misinformation which is the digest of our news.

data.quote: What I'm dealing with is so vast and great that it can't be called the truth. It's above the truth.
data.author: Sun Ra

data.quote: If you tell the truth about how you're feeling, it becomes funny.

data.quote: It would be difficult to discover the truth about the universe if we refused to consider anything that might be true.
data.author: Richard Morris

data.quote: I want a language that speaks the truth.
data.author: Studs Terkel

data.quote: When a truth is necessary, the reason for it can be found by analysis, that is, by resolving it into simpler ideas and truths until the primary ones are reached.
data.author: Gottfried Leibniz

data.quote: The truth is that from birth on we are, to one extent or another, a fairly sensual species.

data.quote: Unemployment is sky-rocketing; deflation is in our future for the first time since the Great Depression. I don't care whose fault it is, it's the truth.
data.author: John Mellencamp

data.quote: This Divine truth flows into heaven from the Lord from His Divine love.
data.author: Emanuel Swedenborg

data.quote: I was a very good baseball and football player, but my father always told me I was much more interested in how I looked playing baseball or football than in actually playing. There's great truth in that.
data.author: John Malkovich

data.quote: On the stage, you have to find truth, even if you have to lose the audience.
data.author: Anthony Quinn

data.quote: I am afraid the Spanish American has not always a very strict regard for truth.
data.author: Edward Burnett Tylor

data.quote: I always try to improve, to find new ways of expressing myself, to keep looking for truth and originality.

data.quote: My assignment is what every writer's assignment is: tell the truth of his own time.

data.quote: I think that the truth is a really stern taskmistress.

data.quote: A gift of truth is the gift of love.

data.quote: I believe certain members of the U.S. Congress have aided in the oppression and diversion of critical information that could have revealed a fullness of truth long ago.

data.quote: A remark generally hurts in proportion to its truth.

data.quote: The truth may be out there, but lies are inside your head.

data.quote: Man approaches the unattainable truth through a succession of errors.

data.quote: Beyond a doubt truth bears the same relation to falsehood as light to darkness.

data.quote: Books and all forms of writing are terror to those who wish to suppress the truth.

data.quote: I speak the truth not so much as I would, but as much as I dare, and I dare a little more as I grow older.

data.quote: The greatest friend of truth is Time, her greatest enemy is Prejudice, and her constant companion is Humility.

data.quote: Poetry a criticism of life under the conditions fixed for such a criticism by the laws of poetic truth and poetic beauty.

data.quote: People do think that if they avoid the truth, it might change to something better before they have to hear it.

data.quote: Truth is not exciting enough to those who depend on the characters and lives of their neighbors for all their amusement.

data.quote: The world is... the natural setting of, and field for, all my thoughts and all my explicit perceptions. Truth does not inhabit only the inner man, or more accurately, there is no inner man, man is in the world, and only in the world does he know himself.

data.quote: In morals, truth is but little prized when it is a mere sentiment, and only attains its full value when realized in the world as fact.

data.quote: Some minds remain open long enough for the truth not only to enter but to pass on through by way of a ready exit without pausing anywhere along the route.

data.quote: I put forward formless and unresolved notions, as do those who publish doubtful questions to debate in the schools, not to establish the truth but to seek it.

data.quote: It is good to express a thing twice right at the outset and so to give it a right foot and also a left one. Truth can surely stand on one leg, but with two it will be able to walk and get around.

data.quote: Truth is the silliest thing under the sun. Try to get a living by the Truth and go to the Soup Societies. Heavens! Let any clergyman try to preach the Truth from its very stronghold, the pulpit, and they would ride him out of his church on his own pulpit bannister.

data.quote: The tendency of modern scientific teaching is to neglect the great books, to lay far too much stress upon relatively unimportant modern work, and to present masses of detail of doubtful truth and questionable weight in such a way as to obscure principles.

data.quote: Justice and truth are too such subtle points that our tools are too blunt to touch them accurately.

data.quote: Friendless. Having no favors to bestow. Destitute of fortune. Addicted to utterance of truth and common sense.
data.author: Ambrose Bierce

data.quote: Truth titillates the imagination far less than fiction.
data.author: Marquis de Sade

data.quote: A gaffe is when a politician tells the truth.

data.quote: Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities. Truth isn't.

data.quote: Truth is the property of no individual but is the treasure of all men.

data.quote: All credibility, all good conscience, all evidence of truth come only from the senses.

data.quote: Power is not sufficient evidence of truth.

data.quote: I am very fond of truth, but not at all of martyrdom.

data.quote: A taste for truth at any cost is a passion which spares nothing.

data.quote: Light is the symbol of truth.

data.quote: I preach there are all kinds of truth, your truth and somebody else's. But behind all of them there is only one truth and that is that there's no truth.

data.quote: My longing for truth was a single prayer.

data.quote: Truth comes out in wine.

data.quote: Truth disappears with the telling of it.

data.quote: Falsehood is cowardice, the truth courage.

data.quote: In the last few years, the very idea of telling the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth is dredged up only as a final resort when the alternative options of deception, threat and bribery have all been exhausted.

data.quote: Everybody in America is soft, and hates conflict. The cure for this, both in politics and social life, is the same - hardihood. Give them raw truth.

data.quote: Slogans which deafened us so that we could not hear the truth.
data.author: Ernst Toller

data.quote: Because you're not what I would have you be, I blind myself to who, in truth, you are.

data.author: William Peter Blatty

data.quote: Mind and spirit together make up that which separates us from the rest of the animal world, that which enables a man to know the truth and that which enables him to die for the truth.
data.author: Edith Hamilton

data.quote: The Spirit is Love expressed towards man as redeeming love, and the Spirit is truth, and the Spirit is the Holy Spirit. Redemption is inconceivable without truth and holiness.
data.author: Roland Allen

data.quote: The idealists dream and the dream is told, and the practical men listen and ponder and bring back the truth and apply it to human life, and progress and growth and higher human ideals come into being and so the world moves ever on.
data.author: Anna Howard Shaw

data.quote: Accuracy of language is one of the bulwarks of truth.
data.author: Anna Jameson

data.quote: Never ever doubt in magic. The purest honest thoughts come from children, ask any child if they believe in magic and they will tell you the truth.
data.author: Scott Dixon

data.quote: The intuition of free will gives us the truth.
data.author: Corliss Lamont

data.quote: The absolute truth is the thing that makes people laugh.

data.quote: The antiquity and general acceptance of an opinion is not assurance of its truth.

data.quote: Any necessary truth, whether a priori or a posteriori, could not have turned out otherwise.
data.author: Saul Kripke

data.quote: Every emancipation has in it the seeds of a new slavery, and every truth easily becomes a lie.
data.author: I. F. Stone

data.quote: The truth cannot be asserted without denouncing the falsehood.

data.quote: I am a fighter. I believe in that which is right, and the truth is, I have been the Lone Ranger for the past thirty years and I will not give up the fight. I love my public and I'll fight for you. I'll continue to make personal appearances for my thousands of fans.

data.quote: The ultimate aim of the human mind, in all its efforts, is to become acquainted with Truth.
data.author: Eliza Farnham

data.quote: Literature boils with the madcap careers of writers brought to the edge by the demands of living on their nerves, wringing out their memories and their nightmares to extract meaning, truth, beauty.
data.author: Herbert Gold

data.quote: I was not out to paint beautiful pictures even painting good pictures was not important to me. I wanted only to help the truth burst forth.

data.quote: He who is not courageous enough to take risks will accomplish nothing in life.
data.author: Muhammad Ali

data.quote: Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them.

data.quote: We don't develop courage by being happy every day. We develop it by surviving difficult times and challenging adversity.
data.author: Barbara De Angelis

data.quote: If you have no confidence in self, you are twice defeated in the race of life.

data.quote: Courage, sacrifice, determination, commitment, toughness, heart, talent, guts. That's what little girls are made of.
data.author: Bethany Hamilton

data.quote: Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: Efforts and courage are not enough without purpose and direction.
data.author: John F. Kennedy

data.quote: The greatest test of courage on earth is to bear defeat without losing heart.
data.author: Robert Green Ingersoll

data.quote: Courage is fire, and bullying is smoke.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: Wisdom, compassion, and courage are the three universally recognized moral qualities of men.
data.author: Confucius

data.quote: Jump, and you will find out how to unfold your wings as you fall.
data.author: Ray Bradbury

data.quote: One isn't necessarily born with courage, but one is born with potential. Without courage, we cannot practice any other virtue with consistency. We can't be kind, true, merciful, generous, or honest.
data.author: Maya Angelou

data.quote: The opposite for courage is not cowardice, it is conformity. Even a dead fish can go with the flow.
data.author: Jim Hightower

data.quote: I think we all have empathy. We may not have enough courage to display it.
data.author: Maya Angelou

data.quote: From caring comes courage.
data.author: Lao Tzu

data.quote: If human beings had genuine courage, they'd wear their costumes every day of the year, not just on Halloween.
data.author: Douglas Coupland

data.quote: Courage is not simply one of the virtues, but the form of every virtue at the testing point.
data.author: C. S. Lewis

data.quote: Courage is grace under pressure.
data.author: Ernest Hemingway

data.quote: Courage, above all things, is the first quality of a warrior.
data.author: Carl von Clausewitz

data.quote: You will never do anything in this world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.
data.author: Aristotle

data.quote: Don't Make Assumptions. Find the courage to ask questions and to express what you really want. Communicate with others as clearly as you can to avoid misunderstandings, sadness and drama. With just this one agreement, you can completely transform your life.

data.quote: Creativity takes courage.

data.quote: As a former NFL player, I am one American who will have nothing to do with any NFL Team that cannot find the corporate courage to stand for the millions of courageous past great Americans whose sacrifice gave meaning to our flag and national anthem and to the millions upon millions who still dream to come to its free shores.

data.quote: Success is not measured by what you accomplish, but by the opposition you have encountered, and the courage with which you have maintained the struggle against overwhelming odds.
data.author: Orison Swett Marden

data.quote: Courage is contagious. When a brave man takes a stand, the spines of others are often stiffened.
data.author: Billy Graham

data.quote: The principles of living greatly include the capacity to face trouble with courage, disappointment with cheerfulness, and trial with humility.
data.author: Thomas S. Monson

data.quote: I know what it is to feel unloved, to want revenge, to make mistakes, to suffer disappointment, yet also to find the courage to go forward in life.

data.quote: Courtesy is as much a mark of a gentleman as courage.
data.author: Theodore Roosevelt
